intro: Planaltina angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf planaltina, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in sandy or well-drained soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
